required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Pasteurized Akkermansia Muciniphila on Insulin Resistance in Otherwise Healthy Subjects With Dysglycaemia
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study to Investigate the Effects of 'Next Generation Beneficial Microbes', Akkermansia Muciniphila (AMF-01), on Long-term Improvements in Insulin Resistance in Otherwise Healthy Hyperglycaemic Adults

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to demonstrate the efficacy of pasteurized Akkermansia muciniphila (pAKK) in improving insulin sensitivity in hyperglycaemic, but otherwise healthy persons with metabolic syndrome. This is the primary objective of this study. Secondary objectives consist of evaluation of the effects of next generation beneficial microbes on metabolic health, anthropometry and body composition, and safety.
Therefore, the trial is designed as a phase 2, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel group, multi-center trial comparing pAKK with placebo in restoring insulin sensitivity in dysglycaemic but otherwise healthy subjects with metabolic syndrome.
In total, 98 enrolled participants will attend 6 study visits in total. Study visits may be conducted in the clinic, at home by a Healthcare Professional, or by telephone / telemedicine.

detailed_description.textblock:
Overweight and obesity have reached worldwide epidemic level. Observation of elevated glycaemia like impaired fasting glucose and impaired glucose tolerance are reflecting pre-diabetic states often occurring in the context of development of insulin resistance in persons with metabolic syndrome. Moreover, this status is associated with the risk for developing type 2 diabetes as well as cardiovascular disease. In a proof of concept study the supplementation with A. muciniphila was safe and improved metabolic health in persons with metabolic syndrome.
The purpose of this study is to demonstrate the efficacy of pasteurized Akkermansia muciniphila (pAKK) in improving insulin sensitivity in hyperglycaemic, but otherwise healthy persons with metabolic syndrome. This is the primary objective of this study. Secondary objectives consist of evaluation of the effects of next generation beneficial microbes on metabolic health, anthropometry and body composition, and safety.
Therefore, the trial is designed as a phase 2, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel group, multi-center trial comparing pAKK with placebo in restoring insulin sensitivity in dysglycaemic but otherwise healthy subjects with metabolic syndrome.
In total, 98 enrolled participants will attend 6 study visits in total. Study visits may be conducted in the clinic, at home by a Healthcare Professional, or by telephone / telemedicine.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel group, multi-center trial
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Absolute change from baseline to day 120 in treatment group as compared to placebo in insulin sensitivity as determined by Matsuda.

secondary_outcome.measure: Insulin sensitivity by homeostasis model assessment-estimated (HOMA) insuline sensitivity
secondary_outcome.description: change in treatment group as compared to placebo by measuring fasting glucose and insulin values

secondary_outcome.measure: fasting blood glucose
secondary_outcome.description: change in treatment group as compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: 3-hour blood glucose incremental Area Under the Curve (AUC) as measured by Oral Glucose Tolerance Test (OGTT)
secondary_outcome.description: change in treatment group as compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of blood glucose as measured by OGTT
secondary_outcome.description: change in treatment group as compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: 3-hour blood insulin incremental Area Under the Curve (AUC) as measured by OGTT
secondary_outcome.description: change in treatment group as compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of blood insulin as measured by OGTT
secondary_outcome.description: change in treatment group as compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Glycosylated hemoglobin (HbA1c)
secondary_outcome.description: change in treatment group as compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Postprandial triglyceride (TG) response as incremental Area Under the Curve (AUC) as measured by OGTT
secondary_outcome.description: change in treatment group as compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of blood TG as measured by OGTT
secondary_outcome.description: change in treatment group as compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood lipid profile by total cholesterol, TG, low density lipoprotein, high density lipoprotein, non-esterified fatty acids
secondary_outcome.description: change in treatment group as compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Liver enzymes (ALT, AST, GGT, bilirubin, alkaline phosphatase)
secondary_outcome.description: change in treatment group as compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Anthropometry by Height (m) and body weight (kg) combined into BMI (kg/m2)
secondary_outcome.description: change in treatment group as compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Circumference (cm) of waist, hip and neck and waist, hip and height measurement will be combined into Waist-to-Hip ratio (W:H) and Waist-to-Height ratio (WHtR)
secondary_outcome.description: change in treatment group as compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Body composition by measurement of body fat mass by DEXA measurement
secondary_outcome.description: change in treatment group as compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Body composition by measurement of lean mass by DEXA measurement
secondary_outcome.description: change in treatment group as compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Body composition by measurement of trunk fat mass by DEXA measurement
secondary_outcome.description: change in treatment group as compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Vital signs: heart rate
secondary_outcome.description: evaluation of heart rate

secondary_outcome.measure: Vital signs: blood pressure
secondary_outcome.description: evaluation of Systolic blood pressure (SBP) (mmHg) and diastolic blood pressure (DBP) (mmHg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Vital signs: body temperature
secondary_outcome.description: evaluation of body temperature

secondary_outcome.measure: Vital signs: respiratory rate
secondary_outcome.description: evaluation of respiratory rate

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: evaluation of occurrence of the nature, frequency, severity and relatedness of adverse events as well as clinically significant laboratory values

arm_group.arm_group_label: Experimental group receiving pasteurized Akkermansia muciniphila
arm_group.description: Experimental group receiving pasteurized Akkermansia muciniphila.
Control group receiving placebo, identical to verum regarding the form, size, taste, color and intake.

intervention.arm_group_label: Experimental group receiving pasteurized Akkermansia muciniphila

intervention.description: Placebo = identical to verum regarding the form, size, taste, color and intake

reference.citation: Depommier C, Everard A, Druart C, Plovier H, Van Hul M, Vieira-Silva S, Falony G, Raes J, Maiter D, Delzenne NM, de Barsy M, Loumaye A, Hermans MP, Thissen JP, de Vos WM, Cani PD. Supplementation with Akkermansia muciniphila in overweight and obese human volunteers: a proof-of-concept exploratory study. Nat Med. 2019 Jul;25(7):1096-1103. doi: 10.1038/s41591-019-0495-2. Epub 2019 Jul 1.
